meanings.definition: relating to or characteristic of a fluid
meanings.sent1: The flueric properties of the liquid made it easy to pour.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the flueric behavior of water in the experiment.
meanings.sent3: The flueric nature of the river made it flow smoothly around the rocks.
meanings.sent4: Her movements were as flueric as the gentle stream winding through the valley.
meanings.sent5: The flueric motion of the waves was mesmerizing to watch.

meanings.definition: a device that uses fluid dynamics for control or measurement
meanings.sent1: The engineer designed a new flueric for precise pressure control.
meanings.sent2: The flueric in the lab helped regulate the flow of chemicals.
meanings.sent3: The flueric on the machine hummed softly as it adjusted the airflow.
meanings.sent4: The flueric was like a conductor orchestrating the movement of liquids.
meanings.sent5: The flueric efficiently controlled the fluid flow in the system.

meanings.definition: a system that utilizes fluid power for operation
meanings.sent1: The factory installed a flueric to enhance the efficiency of production.
meanings.sent2: The flueric in the car engine optimized fuel consumption.
meanings.sent3: The flueric in the hydraulic system worked tirelessly to lift heavy loads.
meanings.sent4: The flueric functioned like a silent worker powering the entire mechanism.
meanings.sent5: The flueric system smoothly operated the machinery without any hiccups.
